div.p: Greetings. I am indeed so distracted that I can hardly manage this.

What I have received from elsewhere, I have included here; let it be trusted by you. I communicate to you what I receive and as I receive it; whether everything is as it seems, let it be. There is fear of an impending war because of Speyer and Worms; but this matter is written to me so covertly and obscurely that I cannot reveal anything certain and clear. It is said that the King of Poland is turning back from his journey to France, because the Pope promises a great amount of gold if he does not go to Poland, and because the king is said to be suffering from a serious and deadly illness, not without suspicion of poison. The situation is complex; but God will overcome all these things. Nor do I write these things as certainties, but I narrate what has been told. I experience daily that there is the utmost freedom to lie. Several good men among us, suddenly and with a deadly illness of the head, have departed to the Lord, and some are still bedridden.
Indeed, I am now called to Mr. Johann MÃ¼ller, a senator, who is said to be at the point of death.
I therefore break off this writing, which I have hastily and therefore very poorly drafted.
Farewell with all our friends and your family. Zurich, 20th November 1573.
To my dear lord and good friend Mr. Tobias Egli, pastor at St. Martin in Chur.
